Articles.Content:
So yeah installed a few extra mods and now the game contues to freeze on load up. Its still running but load progress dos not progress past a certain spot here is my mod list. 

KSP: 0.90 (Win32) - Unity: 4.5.5f1 - OS: Windows 7 Service Pack 1 (6.1.7601) 64bit

USI Tools - 0.3.2

Community Resource Pack - 0.3.3

Contract Configurator - 0.6.6

CC-CP-SCANSat - 0.5

Contract Pack: RemoteTech - 1.0.2

Contracts Window Plus - 1.0.3.4

DMagic Orbital Science - 0.9.2

RasterPropMonitor - 0.19

KSP-AVC Plugin - 1.1.5

Docking Port Alignment Indicator - 5.1

Procedural Parts - 1.0.2

Regolith - 0.1.7

RemoteTech - 1.6.3

SCANsat - 1.1

Ship Manifest - 0.0

TextureReplacer - 2.2.5

TAC Life Support - 0.10.2.15

Karbonite - 0.5.5

Karbonite Plus - 0.3

 so any sugestions or any one know what is going on?

You're probably running out of memory. Install [**Active Texture Management**](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/59005-0-90-Release-4-3-Dec-16-2014-Active-Texture-Management-Save-RAM!) and try again.

> 
> You're probably running out of memory. Install [**Active Texture Management**](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/59005-0-90-Release-4-3-Dec-16-2014-Active-Texture-Management-Save-RAM!) and try again.

there is four types x64 basic, Aggressive. and x86 basic, Aggressive. any idea which one to use ?
It sounds like you're running 32-bit KSP, so you want an x86 version, probably aggressive.
I installed that add on and now it stops load up earler

Does it always stop when loading the exact same file from the exact same mod? In that case that particular file might be corrupted.

Delete that mod, re-download and re-install. (Make sure you have the latest version and that it is compatible with KSP 0.90)

> 
> I installed that add on and now it stops load up earler

Note the ultra-massive warning text in Active Texture management:

> 
> **The first load will take a VERY long time (can be upwards of an hour) and it might take multiple runs if you are close to the memory limit. So sit back and let it load, if it crashes, just bring it up again. Eventually it will load fully. Exit, then load again. It will then load VERY fast, and fully utilize DXT compression/loading.**

What ^ he said, the first load with ATM can take upwards of an hour.

Also just a suggestion, if you are using any new suit or head textures with texture replacer it may be a good idea to have DDSloader installed as some of them use DDS format textures and the base game wont be able to load them, although I don't know if that will cause the game to hang while loading.
